Class BoardController

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • sixmensmorris.BoardController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class BoardController
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    This is a controller for the board class. It acts as an intermediary between the Board model (Board.java), and the Board view (BoardView.java).
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    Kelvin Lin , Zichen Jiang, Jeremy Klotz
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • BoardController

        public BoardController(int N)
        Constructs the screen needed to play the game, and adds all EventListeners needed to obtain input from the user.
        Parameters:
        N - is the number of squares

      • BoardController

        public BoardController(int N,
                       int[] boardState,
                       int turn,
                       int state,
                       boolean removePiece)
        BoardController constructor used for loading games. It takes a boardState, a turn, and a state in addition to the number of layers available so that it can recreate the previous state of the board.
        Parameters:
        N - The number of pieces
        boardState - The state of the board
        turn - Which player's turn
        state - The game state

      • BoardController

        public BoardController(int N,
                       int[] boardState)
        Construct the screen needed to play the game given a certain state, and adds all EventListers needed to obtain input from the user.
        Parameters:
        N - is the number of squares
        boardState - this allows us to construct / update the board based on current state

      • BoardController

        public BoardController(int N,
                       boolean ExistsAI)
        Initialize AI on new game
        Parameters:
        N - is the number of squares
        ExistsAI - is the boolean value to determine whether to enable AI

    • Method Detail

      • initAI

        public void initAI(int AI_colour)
        Initialize AI with given colour. If no colour given, randomly determin AI's colour. Also changes the text in makeAIMove button to tell user what colour the AI is.
        Parameters:
        AI_colour - predefined AI's colour, 1 for blue and 2 for red. -1 if undefined

      • update

        private void update(boolean updateState)
        Updates the display.
        Parameters:
        updateState - will update the game state if true

      • resizeText

        private void resizeText()
        It is used to simply resize the text based on the dimensions of the window This allows for dynamic change, such that the user can play with any size of window

      • updateLabels

        private void updateLabels()
        This method will update the labels of each player involved.

      • updateView

        private void updateView()
        Controller takes information from the view and calls methods from the java.awt library on it

      • updateTitleColour

        private void updateTitleColour()
        This method updates the title JLabel's colour

      • updateState

        private void updateState()
        This method updates the game state

      • updateTitleText

        private void updateTitleText()
        This method updates the title state according to the class. Also, if the state is not place pieces (state = 0), then it hides the blue and red piece counter labels.

      • updateAIButton

        private void updateAIButton()
        Disable the makeAIMove button if on players turn. Enable the button if on AI's turn.

      • updateAI

        private void updateAI()
        Updates AI's board view.

      • placePieceState

        private void placePieceState(int i)
        This method encapsulates the place piece (state = 0) state.
        Parameters:
        i - Where to place the piece

      • noPossibleMoves

        private boolean noPossibleMoves(int colour)
        This method checks all the pieces of a certain colour on the board, and returns true if there are no possible moves to be played by the specified colour.
        Parameters:
        colour - The colour to check
        Returns:
        true if there are no possible moves, false otherwise.

      • movePiece

        private void movePiece(int i)
        This method encapsulates the play game (state = 1) state.
        Parameters:
        i - Where to move the piece

      • removePiece

        private void removePiece(int i)
        This method allows the caller to remove a piece from the board
        Parameters:
        i - Which piece to remove

      • saveGameMouseClicked

        private void saveGameMouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        This method processes the save game event. It saves the state and turn into a text file called ./savedGame.txt. It then records the state of the board into the text file
        Parameters:
        e - The MouseEvent

      • makeAIMoveMouseClicked

        private void makeAIMoveMouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        This method process the AI move event. It will call different APIs from AI for different game state, and use the returned values (positions) to place a piece, move a piece, or remove a piece.
        Parameters:
        e - The MouseEvent
